intro: Thamnochortus sulcatus, commonly known as the serrated bulbinose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a dense cluster at the center of the rosette. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Thamnochortus sulcatus is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
